Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2009 07:35AM dmacw wrote: I was born in 1950.  I regret not going to college.  I listened to my mother and got a job in the secretarial field.  Worked there until 2005.  I retired with 36 years of service and do not regret that.  At my time unless you wanted to become a nurse or a lawyer you didn't go to college.  I seriously regret not going.  I also regret my first marriage.  I stayed married as that was what was expected of me.  We remained married for 23 years.  He passed away at the age of 40.  I found my neil 2 years later.  He is a wonderful man.  We had a long distance relationship until I retired.  I move here the next day and have been with him since.  I have never done anything that has made a difference in anyones life.  Many times feel like a failure. Donna

Posts.Content: dmacw wrote: I'm looking for some help.  I live in NY and have a friend in California.  She found out she had breast cancer on 8/27.  She had a lumpectomy and had some nodes removed.  They did not get clean margins so they did more surgery a couple weeks ago and removed more nodes.  She is going to do chemo and radiation.  She emailed us the other day to say she had her PET scan results and they found 3 spots on her lungs (they don't think is cancer) and a large mass on her liver that is cancer.  I am speechless and don't know what to say to her.  Can everyone her help me?  All I know is she is now doing a different type of chemo then she was scheduled before.  Am I to assume the cancer has spread and not treatable?  I'm looking for something to hang on to.  Please help me talk to her.  Thanks Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 29, 2012 03:23PM dmacw wrote: Ma my husband had DNR and he was in a coma for 2 weeks before passing.  The DNR was not enough.  I had to decide if he should be given food, water, pain meds etc.  I didn't want him to suffer.  I said to the doctor if it was your wife what would you do?  He told me no to food and water, yes to meds to keep him comfortable.  But I don't know if I did right.  I still feel guilty.  Be very specific. Donna

Posts.Title: Having liver biopsy today justjudie K-Lo

Posts.Content: dmacw wrote: Just got back. Tech that did the test said all she saw was a tiny cyst. However, she said I am not the doctor so wait for her results. She did show me the report from the mammo and she said they were not looking for anything bad just a lymph node (that she didn't see) She only saw cyst in the same area that mammo was questioning. Ok so I was relieved a bit. I call a friend to tell them and I got silence. He said, thats how my mother got started. They said a cyst. Lets watch it. She said to the doctor "Does it belong there"? He said no and she said take it out and it ended up being cancer. She is now a 15 yr survivor. So, there went my happiness. The tech was so upbeat and sure of herself. She said they will probably want to watch the cyst. It it grows or it bothers me they will remove it. I am relieved a bit but need your assistance here. Thanks to all. Log in to post a reply
